intro: Tetratelia, commonly known as the common tetratelia, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. Tetratelia species often have hollow stems and are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of the carrot family.
